comments_since_last_sample.body: Beautiful.  That black wash is fantastic.  Going to try that on an oak armoire I want to update.

My husband and I are new at flipping furniture so we had no idea about not mixing oil based poly and water based paint but after yousaid it,it made complete sense.  My mother-in-law gave us all her furniture that is at least 50yrs old so we are redoing them, thank you for the info.  I loved the color of the old version but yours was really beautiful and done correctly, lol.
That's gorgeous. .I love the black wash and can totally see the rage with pottery barn ..👍🤩
I used to think white was my favorite but now I’m not so sure. The black looks amazing!

I did a black wash on a small table top (pine) and painted the bottom full strength black for my personal use and I love the wash look. I was wondering how it wood look on a whole piece like this. I love it. Maybe for those tired of white will go for it, but I still like your natural off white/beige look too.

Debbi here.  I love how this turned out however I have a question.  Why did you choose to not sand out the white primer that remained on the inside of the drawer frames.  It seems like such a small detail but I couldn’t help thinking that it made as a difference.  Love your work!
